thread.title: Ground News - Inland Empire man rescues near-dead dog from freeway shoulder
thread.title_full: Ground News - Inland Empire man rescues near-dead dog from freeway shoulder

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Inland Empire man rescues near-dead dog from freeway shoulder
text:
Summary by Ground News David Loop stumbled upon what he thought were the remains of a black labrador sitting at the side of the freeway. Loop believed the dog, whom he later named Shiloh, was hit by a car and sat by the shoulder of the road for several days. The dog was paralyzed and had bones in his stomach, according to Loop. His mission turned into his life as he founded the Sierra Pacific Furbabies. While the organization specializes in helping rescue kittens and cats, it has never turned its back on a dog or puppy in need. That …
